Character: Lobule on underside of leaf completely crossing the stem; stem in cross section differentiated into small thick walled outer cells and large, thin walled central cells.
Lobule on leaf underside crossing less than half the width of the stem. Cortical and medullary cells of stem similar
Microphyllous branches present; trigones of dorsal leaf lobes large, distinct
Microphyllous branches absent; trigones of dorsal leaf lobes absent or weakly- to moderately-developed

Cells of dorsal leaf lobes uniformly thin-walled, trigones absent; rhizoids absent; stems usually producing an abundance of small, spreading branches (one per leaf) that give the shoots a plume-like habit
Cells of dorsal leaf lobes with weakly- to moderately-developed trigones; rhizoids present; stems not producing an abundance of small, spreading branches, not plume-like in habit

Dorsal leaf lobes ovate to obovate, apices bluntly angular to rounded, inner margins adnate to stem, mid-leaf cells ca. 15-20 μm; ventral leaf lobes inflated, rhomboidal-ovate, ca. 1/2 -1/3x the length of the dorsal lobes; plants dioicous

Dorsal leaf lobes broadly ovate, apices rounded, inner margins not adnate to stem, mid-leaf Dorsal leaf lobes broadly ovate, apices rounded, inner margins not adnate to stem, mid-leaf cells ca. 20-25 μm; ventral leaf lobes not inflated, quadrate to subquadrate, ca. 1/4x the length of the dorsal lobes; plants paraoicous
